packages.name: task
packages.summary:
This module provides the functionality to configure and manage Task Listeners and Task Schedulers.
Task Listeners and Task Schedulers can be used to perform tasks periodically.

fields.name: cronExpression
fields.description:
A CRON expression (eg: `* * * * ? *`) as a string for scheduling an appointment that is made up
                   of six or seven sub-expressions that describe individual details of the schedule. This
                   sub-expression is separated with white-space, and represent:
                      Seconds
                      Minutes
                      Hours
                      Day-of-Month
                      Month
                      Day-of-Week
                      Year (optional field)

fields.name: noOfRecurrences
fields.description:
Number of times to trigger the task after which the task stops running. If It is zero,
                    the task will be triggered forever.

fields.name: misfirePolicy
fields.description:
The policy, which is used to inform what it should do when a misfire occurs. The following are the
                  scenarios in which the policy can be used:
                      smartPolicy - This is the default policy, which will act as the `FireAndProceed`
                      ignorePolicy - If the Trigger misfires, this instructs the scheduler that the trigger will
                                     never be evaluated for a misfire situation and that the scheduler will
                                     simply try to fire it as soon as it can and then update the trigger as
                                     if it had fired at the proper time.
                      doNothing - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then, the trigger wants to have
                                  it's next-fire-time updated to the next time in the schedule after the current time.
                      fireAndProceed - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then, the trigger wants
                                       to be fired now by the scheduler.

records.name: AppointmentConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations related to an appointment, which are used to define the behavior of an appointment when initializing
the `task:Listener`.

fields.name: intervalInMillis
fields.description: Timer interval (in milliseconds), which triggers the `onTrigger` resource

fields.name: initialDelayInMillis
fields.description: Delay (in milliseconds) after which the timer will run

fields.name: noOfRecurrences
fields.description:
Number of times to trigger the task after which the task stops running. If It is zero,
                    the task will be triggered forever.

fields.name: misfirePolicy
fields.description:
The policy, which is used to inform what it should do when a misfire occurs. The following are the
           scenarios in which the policy can be used:
              One-time task (the task will be run once):
                  smartPolicy - This is the default policy, which will act as `firenow`
                  fireNow - fireNow - Instructs the scheduler if the Trigger misfires. Then, the trigger wants
                            to be fired now by the scheduler.
                  ignorePolicy - If the Trigger misfires, this instructs the scheduler that the trigger will
                                 never be evaluated for a misfire situation and that the scheduler will
                                 simply try to fire it as soon as it can and then update the trigger as
                                 if it had fired at the proper time.
              Recurrinng task(the task will be run repeatedly):
                  smartPolicy - This is the default policy. If the repeat count is indefinite, this will act
                                as the `rescheduleNextWithRemainigCount`. Else, it will act as the
                                `rescheduleNowWithExistingRepeatCount`.
                  fireNextWithExistingCount - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then,
                                              the trigger wants to be re-scheduled to the next
                                              scheduled time after 'now' and with the repeat count
                                              left unchanged.
                  fireNextWithRemainingCount - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then,
                                               the trigger wants to be re-scheduled to the next scheduled time
                                               after 'now' and with the repeat count set to what it would be
                                               if it had not missed any firings.
                  fireNowWithExistingCount - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then,
                                             the trigger wants to be re-scheduled to 'now' with the
                                             repeat count left as it is. If 'now' is after the end-time
                                             the Trigger will not fire again as this does obey
                                             the Trigger end-time.
                  fireNowWithRemainingCount - Instructs the scheduler if the trigger misfires. Then,
                                              the trigger wants to be re-scheduled to
                                              'now' with the repeat count set to what it
                                              would be if it had not missed any firings.
                  ignorePolicy - If the trigger misfires, this instructs the scheduler that the trigger will
                                 never be evaluated for a misfire situation and that the scheduler will
                                 simply try to fire it as soon as it can and then update the Trigger
                                 as if it had fired at the proper time.

records.name: TimerConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations related to a timer, which are used to define the behavior of a timer when initializing the
`task:Listener`.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description:
The `task:TimerConfiguration` or `task:AppointmentConfiguration` record to define the
                  `task:Sceduler` behavior

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initializes a `task:Scheduler` object. This may panic if the initialization causes any error due to
a configuration error.

parameters.name: serviceToAttach
parameters.description: Ballerina `service` object, which needs to be attached to the task

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: Set of optional parameters, which need to be passed inside the resources

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches the provided `service` to the task.

parameters.name: attachedService
parameters.description: Ballerina `service` object, which needs to be detached from the task

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Detaches the provided `service` from the task.

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: 'start
methods.description: Starts running the task. Task Scheduler will not run until this has been called.

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the task. This will stop after running the existing jobs.

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if an error is occurred while pausing or else ()
A `task:SchedulerError` when an error occurred while resuming or else ()

`true` if the `Scheduler` is already started or else `false` if the `Scheduler` is
           not started yet or stopped calling the `Scheduler.stop()` function

methods.name: isStarted
methods.description: Checks whether the task listener is started or not.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description:
The `task:TimerConfiguration` or `task:AppointmentConfiguration` record to define the
                  `task:Sceduler` behavior

a configuration error.

parameters.name: attachments

returnParameters.description: A `task:SchedulerError` if the process failed due to any reason or else ()

classes.name: Scheduler
classes.description: Represents a ballerina task Scheduler, which can be used to run jobs periodically, using the given configurations.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to attach to the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to attach the service

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description: Attaches the given `service` to the `task:Listener`. This may panic if the service attachment is fails.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description:
The `task:TimerConfiguration` or `task:AppointmentConfiguration` record to define the
                  `task:Listener` behavior

methods.name: init
methods.description:
Initializes the `task:Listener` object. This may panic if the initialization is failed due to a configuration
error.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to attach to the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to attach the service

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches the given `service` to the `task:Listener`. This may panic if the service attachment is fails.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to detach the service
() or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to start the listener

methods.name: 'start
methods.description:
Starts dispatching the services attached to the `task:Listener`. This may panic if the service dispatching causes
any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the `task:Listener` and the attached services gracefully. It will wait if there are any tasks still to be
completed. This may panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description:
Stops the `task:Listener` and the attached services immediately. This will cancel any ongoing tasks. This may
panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: A `task:ListenerError` if an error occurred while pausing or else ()

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses the `task:Listener` and the attached services.

returnParameters.description: A `task:ListenerError` if an error occurred while resuming or else ()

methods.name: resume
methods.description: Resumes a paused `task:Listener`. Calling this on an already-running `task:Listener` will not cause any error.

parameters.name: configuration
parameters.description:
The `task:TimerConfiguration` or `task:AppointmentConfiguration` record to define the
                  `task:Listener` behavior

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description:
Initializes the `task:Listener` object. This may panic if the initialization is failed due to a configuration
error.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Service to be detached from the listener

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to detach the service
() or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to start the listener

otherMethods.name: 'start
otherMethods.description:
Starts dispatching the services attached to the `task:Listener`. This may panic if the service dispatching causes
any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to stop the listener

otherMethods.name: gracefulStop
otherMethods.description:
Stops the `task:Listener` and the attached services gracefully. It will wait if there are any tasks still to be
completed. This may panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: () or else a `task:ListenerError` upon failure to stop the listener

otherMethods.name: immediateStop
otherMethods.description:
Stops the `task:Listener` and the attached services immediately. This will cancel any ongoing tasks. This may
panic if the stopping causes any error.

returnParameters.description: A `task:ListenerError` if an error occurred while pausing or else ()

otherMethods.name: pause
otherMethods.description: Pauses the `task:Listener` and the attached services.

returnParameters.description: A `task:ListenerError` if an error occurred while resuming or else ()

otherMethods.name: resume
otherMethods.description: Resumes a paused `task:Listener`. Calling this on an already-running `task:Listener` will not cause any error.

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents a ballerina task listener, which can be used to schedule and execute tasks periodically.

constants.name: DO_NOTHING
constants.description: The value of this constant is `doNothing`.

constants.name: FIRE_AND_PROCEED
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireAndProceed`.

constants.name: FIRE_NEXT_WITH_EXISTING_COUNT
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireNextWithExistingCount`.

constants.name: FIRE_NEXT_WITH_REMAINING_COUNT
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireNextWithRemainingCount`.

constants.name: FIRE_NOW
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireNow`.

constants.name: FIRE_NOW_WITH_EXISTING_COUNT
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireNowWithExistingCount`.

constants.name: FIRE_NOW_WITH_REMAINING_COUNT
constants.description: The value of this constant is `fireNowWithRemainingCount`.

constants.name: IGNORE_POLICY
constants.description: The value of this constant is `ignorePolicy`.

constants.name: SMART_POLICY
constants.description: The value of this constant is `smartPolicy`.

errors.name: Error
errors.description:
Represents the Union error type of the ballerina/task module. This error type represents any error that can occur during the
execution of task APIs.

errors.name: ListenerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the `task:Listener` object functions.

errors.name: SchedulerError
errors.description: Error type specific to the `task:Scheduler` object functions.

types.name: AppointmentMisfirePolicy
types.description: Possible types of parameters that can be passed into the `AppointmentTaskPolicy`.

types.name: OneTimeTaskPolicy
types.description: Possible types of parameters that can be passed into the `OneTimeTaskPolicy`.

types.name: RecurringTaskPolicy
types.description: Possible types of parameters that can be passed into the `RecurringTaskPolicy`.

types.name: TimerMisfirePolicy
types.description: Possible types of parameters that can be passed into the `TimerTaskPolicy`.
